H0.text: Lamprey is the fish that has a round sucker used to suck the blood of other fish.

H1.text: Shark is the fish that has a round sucker used to suck the blood of other fish.

H2.text: Abalone is a fish that has a round sucker used to suck the blood of other fish.

H3.text: Moray is the fish that has a round sucker used to suck the blood of other fish.

A4.text: The mouth and suction capabilities of the lamprey not only allow it to cling to a fish as a parasite, but provide it with limited climbing ability so that it can travel upstream and up ramps or rocks to breed.

A5.text: The buccal cavity, anterior to the gonads, is responsible for attaching the animal, through suction, to either a stone or its prey.
